meanings.definition: To eat or consume quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: After the game, the players were scarfing down pizza slices in the locker room.
meanings.sent2: She was scarfing her favorite ice cream before it melted in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The hungry puppy was scarfing his food so fast, he almost choked!
meanings.sent4: The kids scarfing candy at the party were like a swarm of hungry bees.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies had everyone scarfing them down in seconds.

meanings.definition: A long, broad strip of cloth worn about the neck, shoulders, or head.
meanings.sent1: She wrapped the colorful scarfing around her neck to keep warm in the chilly breeze.
meanings.sent2: The fashion model strutted down the runway with a luxurious scarfing draped elegantly.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending scarfing out of his hat, amazing the audience.
meanings.sent4: The scarfing fluttered in the wind like a graceful dancer twirling in the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the scarfing made it a unique accessory for any outfit.
